document.title: Living the Virtual Library Life.
document.abstract: Sites such as Facebook, YouTube, MySpace, and Second Life provide a personal, but virtual, library presence to link librarians and library patrons. Many think that Second Life, peopled by avatars and created by Linden Research Inc, could be a way for librarians to reach each other and maintain social connections, as well as serve continuing education.
document.publication-title: School of Information Sciences -- Faculty Publications and Other Works

field.name: custom_citation
field.value: Tenopir, Carol. “Living the Virtual Library Life,” Library Journal 132 (October 1, 2007).
